content.description: Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = 2x(1 - x) and <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </math> for  <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>. The graphs of f and g are shown in the figure above.
content.question: Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the graphs of f and g.

frqParts.text: Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the graphs of f and g.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using ƒ'(x), y', and dy/dx).
